inclusion.criterion: age less than 45 years old when receiving total or near-total thyroidectomy
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: serum level of TSH<0.1 mU/L in the intermediate -risk or TSH<0.3 mU/L in the low recurrence-risk group over 2 years before study entry
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: receiving TSH suppressive therapy for 5 to 9 years with fixed dose of LT4 more than 2 years before study entry
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: no history of structural heart disease, arrhythmia, or cardiac symptoms (palpitation, exertional dyspnea and chest discomfort) during therapy
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: the subject matched to a patient by age (±2 years), sex, and body mass index (BMI) (±2 kg/m2)
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: within the reference range of serum TSH (0.3-4.6 mU/L)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: no history of structural heart disease, arrhythmia, or cardiac symptoms
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: no history of comorbid diseases which affect thyroxine metabolism and cardiac structure, including hepatic or renal disease, anemia, and hypertension
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: who had arrhythmia in electrography or history of cardiac disease
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient has Hashimoto's thyroiditis, high TSH level (13 mU/L), and low free T4 level (0.2 ng/dl). She was diagnosed with Hashimoto's thyroiditis and her symptoms improved significantly after starting Levothyroxine per day.
